topic_or_construct: perceived moral wrongness of an action
justification: Participants were asked “how morally wrong is this act?” and responded on a 7-point scale that ranged from 1 (Not at all wrong) to 7 (Very wrong).

topic_or_construct: perceived moral character of the actor
justification: Participants were asked “how would you judge this person’s moral character?”, responding on a 7-point scale from 1 (Extremely immoral) to 7 (Extremely moral).
The Moral Foundations Questionnaire … is a thirty-item scale that measures five domains of moral reasoning: harm, fairness, loyalty, authority, and purity.
The MFQ is described as measuring five domains of moral reasoning, explicitly including fairness.
The same sentence notes that loyalty is one of the five moral domains assessed by the MFQ.
Participants completed the MFQ, and the study repeatedly refers to participants’ Authority score to index how strongly they ‘view respect for authority as a moral good.’
Purity is listed among the five moral domains that the thirty-item MFQ measures.
